Package com.sicomsa.dmt.svc

Class AbstractSvc<P,Q>

java.lang.Object
com.sicomsa.dmt.svc.AbstractSvc<P,Q>
Type Parameters:
P - resPonse, the type of response this service will return
Q - reQuest, the type of request this service will receive as a parameter.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service<P,Q>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractGenericSvc, AuthenticationSvc
public abstract class AbstractSvc<P,Q> extends Object implements Service<P,Q>
Abstract implementation of Service.

This class implements method callTheService and leaves several methods unimplemented. To create a concrete Service as a subclass of AbstractSvc you need to provide implementations for the following methods:

  • public String getServiceName();
  • public String getLocation();
  • public String getSoapAction();
  • public P parseReceivedMessage(SOAPMessage message, Instant instant, Q request) throws SOAPException;
  • protected void addSignedContent(SOAPMessage message, Credentials credentials, Q request)
    throws SOAPException, GeneralSecurityException, SvcSignatureException;
Since:
1.0
Version:
2025.01.04
Author:
Beto Lopez

      Returns the location this service should connect to

      This location will be used to connect to the web service

      Returns:

    • getSoapAction

      public abstract String getSoapAction()
      Returns the SOAP action this service invokes.

      This action will be set in the headers of the SOAPMessages sent by this service.

      Returns:
      the SOAP action this service invokes.

    • parseReceivedMessage

      public abstract P parseReceivedMessage(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message, Instant instant, Q request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Returns an instance of type P with the information of the SOAPMessage received from the web service. Instant and request can be used to build on the response to return, it is up to the implementation.
      Parameters:
      message - received from the web service.
      instant - instant when the message was received
      request - request used to send the request that originated the message we are parsing here.
      Returns:
      a response of type P
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems

    • addSignedContent

      protected abstract void addSignedContent(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message, Credentials credentials, Q request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException, GeneralSecurityException, SvcSignatureException
      Adds content to the specified SOAPMessage, using the specified parameters and signs the message.
      Parameters:
      message - to be signed after adding some content
      credentials - to be used to sign the message
      request - to be used to append data to the message
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      GeneralSecurityException - if there were security problems while signing message
      SvcSignatureException - if there were other signature related problems

    • callTheService

      public P callTheService(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn, Credentials creds, Q request, String token) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Creates a SOAPMessage using the specified parameters and sends it to the endpoint this service implements; blocks until it receives the response as a SOAPMessage that then parses in order to return a response of type P.

      If the SOAPMessage that this service receives is a SOAPFault a SOAPFaultException should be thrown unless stated otherwise by subclass.

      Specified by:
      callTheService in interface Service<P,Q>
      Parameters:
      conn - connection to use to connect to WS
      creds - credentials to use to sign SOAPMessage
      request - a request of type Q
      token - a token which could be null or blank in some services. For example, to authenticate we do not need to send a token.
      Returns:
      a response of type P
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      IllegalArgumentException - if connection or credentials are null
      jakarta.xml.ws.soap.SOAPFaultException - if message received was a SOAPFault
      SvcParseException - if there were problems while parsing message received from WS
      SvcSignatureException - if there were signature related problems

    • logMessage

      protected String logMessage(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message)
      Returns the specified message as string
      Parameters:
      message - message to convert
      Returns:
      the specified message as string

    • createMessageToSend

      public jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage createMessageToSend(Credentials credentials, Q request, String token) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Creates and returns the SOAPMessage to send to the WS.

      This method creates a new SOAPMessage, adds the namespaces required; fills ands signs the message with the parameters received; sets the headers and returns the message ready to be sent.

      Parameters:
      credentials - credentials to be used to sign message
      request - with the content to be added to the request
      token - the token to use to identify with SAT. In some cases it could be null or blank.
      Returns:
      the message to send
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      NullPointerException - if credentials are null
      SvcSignatureException - if there were signature related problems

    • callService

      public jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage callService(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection connection, jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Uses specified connection to call the web service sending the specified request. Returns the SOAPMessage received from the connection.

      The location to send the message to will be obtained from this service's getLocation() method.

      Parameters:
      connection - the connection to use
      request - the request to send
      Returns:
      the message received from the connection's call to the WS
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there was a SOAP error
      NullPointerException - if connection is null

    • fillAndSign

      protected void fillAndSign(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message, Credentials credentials, Q request) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Adds request content to the message and signs it.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to sign after adding content
      credentials - credentials to use to fill and sign the message
      request - request containing data used to fill the message
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if SOAP related problems arose
      NullPointerException - if message or credentials are null
      SvcSignatureException - if there were signature related problems

    • newMessage

      protected jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage newMessage() throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Returns a new SOAPMessage using this service's message context.
      Returns:
      the new SOAPMessage
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - it there were SOAP related

    • addNamespaces

      protected void addNamespaces(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPEnvelope envelope) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Adds the namespaces this service requires to create message to sign and send to web service.

      This implementation adds the digital signature namespace. You should call super.addNamespaces(envelope) is you are overriding this method and need the digital signature namespace.

      Parameters:
      envelope - envelope to add the namespace to.
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - - if there is an error in creating the namespaces
      NullPointerException - if envelope is null

    • setHeaders

      protected void setHeaders(jakarta.xml.soap.MimeHeaders headers, String token)
      Sets "SOAPAction" and "Authorization" attributes to headers specified.

      Uses method getSoapAction() of this service to set the SOAP action and the token received to set the authorization value.

      Parameters:
      headers - to update
      token - to set to headers
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if headers is null

    • checkFault

      protected void checkFault(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage message) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Throws a SOAPFaultException if the message specified is a SOAPFault.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to validate
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      NullPointerException - if message is null
      jakarta.xml.ws.soap.SOAPFaultException - if message received is a SOAPFault

    • faultMessage

      protected String faultMessage(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPFault fault)
      Returns a string representation of the SOAPFault specified.
      Parameters:
      fault - the fault specified
      Returns:
      a string representation of the fault specified.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if fault is null
